summary: This document is a set of daily lieutenant's logs from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, NY, for July 11, 2019. It details routine operations, counts, and inmate movements, including noting an inmate on psychological observation with a companion and an inmate at a local hospital with USMS guards. The logs show standard facility checks and counts throughout the day.

persons.name: Vanier
persons.context: Inmate referenced by name and registration number (86408-054) in the log, with an investigation noted at 1:00 PM.

events.title: Daily Facility Operations and Inmate Monitoring
events.description: Routine operations at the Metropolitan Correctional Center including multiple institutional counts, body alarm testing, equipment checks, and inmate movements. Specific notes include an inmate on psychological observation with a companion and an inmate at a local hospital with USMS guards.

events.title: Inmate Investigation
events.description: An SIS investigation was noted as occurring at 1:00 PM regarding inmate Vanier (Reg: 86408-054).

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: The logs are from July 11, 2019, the day Jeffrey Epstein was found deceased in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (though his name is not explicitly mentioned in this text).
An inmate (Vanier, Reg: 86408-054) was the subject of an SIS investigation noted at 1:00 PM.
The logs note an inmate on psychological observation with an inmate companion.
The logs note an inmate at a local hospital with USMS (U.S. Marshals Service) guards.
The document reflects standard correctional facility procedures including counts, equipment checks, and security protocols.
